intro: Melampyrum roseum var. sendaiense, commonly known as the Sendai blush touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its striking pink to reddish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable habitats.
